sub_title: Office Assistant at Scots International Church Rotterdam
summary:
Bob has been a development practisioner throughout his working career, starting as a volunteer in Kenya in the mid sixties, assisting sucarcane farmer forming their cooperative. He worked in adult education in Cameroon, set up a training centre for western volunteers in Tanzania, was a teamleader for volunteers in Cameroon and later Tanzania. He also was the Director for Netherlands Volunteers and Honorary Vice-Consul in Benin, Second Secretary at The Netherlands Embassy in Tanzania, Ethiopia and Ghana, in charge of Development Cooperation, Culture, Press and Information.
Bob now resides in Rotterdam and advises various NGO's in Africa as well as among the African Diaspora in The Netherlands. He is also engaged in the Scots International Church and writes in The African Bulletin.

Specialties: Working knowledge of African countries and regions, institutional development, migrant and diaspora communities issues.
